member.name: T:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.StateComponent
member.summary: This class is designed the control a state attribute of a block in your Tesira configuration.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.StateComponent.Configure(System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: This method is used for intial configuration of the component and must be set prior to controlling a specific block in your Tesira configuration.
member.param: This parameter determines which Command Processor you would like to associate this component with in your program.
This parameter is where you associate this component with a specific block's Instance Tag in your Tesira configuration.

This parameter is where you decide which type of state attribute you would like to control. The options are as follows:
- "mute" (Mute Block)
- "inputMute" (Input Block)
- "outputMute" (Output Block)
- "channelMute" (Specific channel of a block)
- "crosspoint" (Crosspoint state)
- "crosspointLevel" (Crosspoint Level Mute)
- "wallState" (Closed wall state)
- "muteOut" (Mute Output of Room Combiner Block)
- "muteIn" (Mute Input of Room Combiner Block)
- "muteSource" (Mute Source of Room Combiner Block)
- "state" (Generic state control)
- "connected" (Host Connection Status State for USB Block)
- "hostMasterMute" (Host Master Mute for USB Block)
- "hostMute" (Host Mute for USB Block)
- "streaming" (Streaming Status for USB Block)
- "embeddedAudioMute" (Embedded Audio Mute for AV Output Block for TesiraLux)
- "videoMute" (Video Mute for AV Output Block for TesiraLux)
- "videoFreeze" (Video Freeze for AV Output Block for TesiraLux)
- "auxMute" (Auxiliary Audio Mute for AV Input Block for TesiraLux)

When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the input value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block, set to 1. If controlling a multi-channel Block, use Index1 to determine channel #
When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the output value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block or a multi-channel Block, set to 0.

- ‘24’ = "Transfer Active"
- ‘29’ = "Transfer Wait"
- ‘27’ = "Transfer Decision"
- ‘28’ = "Transfer Init Error"
- ‘26’ = "Transfer On Hold"
- ‘23’ = "Transfer Replaces Process"
- ‘22’ = "Transfer Process"
- ‘255’ = "Unknown"

member.summary: This method is used for intial configuration of the component and must be set prior to controlling a specific block in your Tesira configuration.

This parameter is where you associate this component with the "TI Dialer" block's Instance Tag in your Tesira configuration.

This parameter will determine whether you wish to control a Source Selector block or a Router block. The options are as follows:

- "sourceSelection" (Using a Source Selector block)

member.name: T:BiampTesiraLib3.BiampTesira
member.summary:
The BiampTesira class is used to instantiate a Command Processor. BiampTesira is the class responsible for establishing communication between your program and the Tesira device, as well as registering components to the Command Processor. This class is required in order to utilize other components.
- Along with Command processor, you need to instantiate one or more of the following components:
-------------------------------
AVInputComponent
AVOutputComponent
DialerComponent
GenericComponent
LevelComponent
PassThruComponent
PresetComponent
RouterComponent
StateComponent
VoipDialerComponent
-------------------------------- In order to set up components, 'Configure' method must be called within each component.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.BiampTesira.Disconnect
member.summary: Use this method to close the established connection between the Command Processor and the Tesira device. (Only applies when connected over Telnet or SSH)

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.BiampTesira.Initialize(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Use this method to register all components in your program to the Command Processor after a connection has been established. This is required before using any other components.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.BiampTesira.Configure(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method must be called before the use of any other methods.
member.param:
This parameter will determine the type of connectivity to the Tesira device. Select from the following options:
0 = Telnet
1 = SSH
2 = RS232
This parameter will determine which the instance of the Command Processor. There are 32 instances allowed in a program.
This parameter determines the IP address of the Tesira device you wish to connect to.
If the Tesira unit is secured, enter the username of the system here. If the device is not secured, the default Username is: "default"
If the Tesira unit is secured, enter the password of the system here. If the device is not secured, enter a blank value: "".

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.ConfigInfo.LevelConfigInfo.#ctor(System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: This method is used to access all of the information associated with the configuration of this component.
member.param: This parameter determines which Command Processor you would like to associate this component with in your program.
This parameter is where you associate this component with a specific block's Instance Tag in your Tesira configuration.

This parameter determines the attribute code of the block your would like to control the level of. The options are as follows:
- "level" (Level Block)
- "inputLevel" (Input Block)
- "crosspointLevel" (Matrix Mixer Crosspoint)
- "channelLevel" (Specific channel of a block)
- "sourceLevel" (Source Selector)
- "levelOut" (Output of a Room Combiner Block)
- "levelIn" (Input of a Room Combiner Block)
- "levelSource" (Source level of a Room Combiner Block)
- "hostMasterVol" (Host master level of a USB block)
- "hostVol" (Host level of a USB Block
- "auxLevel" (Auxilary level of a TesiraLux block)

When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the input value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block, set to 1. If controlling a multi-channel Level Block, use Index1 to determine channel #
When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the output value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block or a multi-channel Level Block, set to 0.
This parameter determines the dB offset for incrementing or decrementing level. Valid values: 1 through 6.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.GenericComponent.Configure(System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: This method is used for intial configuration of the component and must be set prior to controlling a specific block in your Tesira configuration.
member.param: This parameter determines which Command Processor you would like to associate this component with in your program.
This parameter is where you associate this component with a specific block's Instance Tag in your Tesira configuration.
This parameter is where you enter the desired Attribute Code of the attribute you want to control. Refer to the Tesira software's help file for attribute codes.

When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the input value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block, set to 1. If controlling a multi-channel Block, use Index1 to determine channel #
When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the output value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block or a multi-channel Block, set to 0.

This parameter determines the type of signals you would like to use with his component. The values are follows:
- "0" (Set to Digital)
- "1" (Set to Analog)
- "2" (Set to Serial)

This parameter indicates whether the block you are controlling has subscription capabilities. If set to Yes, this component will attempt to subscribe to supported state changes.
- "0" (No)
- "1" (Yes)

member.name: T:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.LevelComponent
member.summary: This class is designed to control the level attribute of a block in your Tesira configuration.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.LevelComponent.Configure(System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: This method is used for intial configuration of the component and must be set prior to controlling a specific block in your Tesira configuration.
member.param: This parameter determines which Command Processor you would like to associate this component with in your program.
This parameter is where you associate this component with a specific block's Instance Tag in your Tesira configuration.

This parameter determines the attribute code of the block your would like to control the level of. The options are as follows:
- "level" (Level Block)
- "inputLevel" (Input Block)
- "crosspointLevel" (Matrix Mixer Crosspoint)
- "channelLevel" (Specific channel of a block)
- "sourceLevel" (Source Selector)
- "levelOut" (Output of a Room Combiner Block)
- "levelIn" (Input of a Room Combiner Block)
- "levelSource" (Source level of a Room Combiner Block)
- "hostMasterVol" (Host master level of a USB block)
- "hostVol" (Host level of a USB Block
- "auxLevel" (Auxilary level of a TesiraLux block)

When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the input value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block, set to 1. If controlling a multi-channel Level Block, use Index1 to determine channel #
When this parameter is not required, set to 0. In most cases this parameter represents the output value of a block. If controlling a single-channel block or a multi-channel Level Block, set to 0.
This parameter determines the dB offset for incrementing or decrementing level. Valid values: 1 through 6.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.LevelComponent.UnRegister
member.summary: This method will unregister this component from the Command Processor it is associated with.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.LevelComponent.Raise
member.summary: This method raises the level of desired level attribute using the set step value. Call method 'Stop' when complete.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.LevelComponent.Lower
member.summary: This method lowers the level of desired level attribute using the set step value. Call method 'Stop' when complete.

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.LevelComponent.Stop
member.summary: This method stops the ramp of a level attribute. Typically used when button is released.

member.summary: This method is used to push the value of the parameter "level" to the desired attribute in your Tesira configuration.
member.param: This parameter is where to set the desired level of an attribute in dB. If the chosen dB level is outside of the min/max range of your level block, there will be no change

member.name: M:BiampTesiraLib3.Components.LevelComponent.SetPercent(System.UInt16)
member.summary: This method is used to push the value of the parameter "percent" to the desired attribute in your Tesira configuration.
member.param: This parameter is where to determine the desired level percentage relative to your Tesira configuration block's minimum and maximum level.

member.summary: This method is used to get the current level in decibals from the desired level attribute.
member.returns: If the current level is out of range, it will return the minimum limit of the level block in your Tesira program.
